translations.Please provide the old recovery password: Please provide the old recovery password

Invalid private key for encryption app. Please update your private key password in your personal settings to recover access to your encrypted files.
translations.Encryption App is enabled, but your keys: Encryption App is enabled, but your keys are not initialized. Please log-out and log-in again.
translations.Please enable server side encryption in: Please enable server side encryption in the admin settings in order to use the encryption module.
translations.Encryption app is enabled and ready: Encryption app is enabled and ready
translations.The administration enabled server-side-e: The administration enabled server-side-encryption. Your files were encrypted using the password %s.
The administration enabled server-side-encryption. Your files were encrypted using the password "%s".
translations.Please login to the web interface, go to: Please login to the web interface, go to the "Security" section of your personal settings and update your encryption password by entering this password into the "Old login password" field and your current login password.
translations.Cannot decrypt this file, probably this: Cannot decrypt this file, probably this is a shared file. Please ask the file owner to reshare the file with you.
translations.Cannot read this file, probably this is: Cannot read this file, probably this is a shared file. Please ask the file owner to reshare the file with you.
translations.Default encryption module for Nextcloud: Default encryption module for Nextcloud Server-side Encryption (SSE)
translations.This app provides the (default) cryptogr:
This app provides the (default) cryptography implementation for Nextcloud's Server-side Encryption (SSE) feature.

			**Encryption Details**
			*   **Cipher Mode:** AES-256-CTR (default)
			*   **Authentication:** HMAC-SHA256

			**Important Warnings**
			*   **DANGER:** Do not disable this application until all files have been decrypted (`occ encryption:decrypt-all`).
			*   **WARNING**: Reverting to non-encrypted file storage after activation requires command-line access. The action is permanent via the Web UI."

			**Notes for Existing Files**
			*   By default, enabling SSE does not encrypt existing files; only new files will be encrypted.
			*   To encrypt all existing files, use the command `occ encryption:encrypt-all`.

			**Before You Begin**
			*   **Read the Documentation:** Before you enable SSE, encrypt existing files, or disable SSE, it is critical to 
				read the documentation to understand implications and the appropriate procedures to avoid data loss.
translations.Encryption app is enabled but your keys: Encryption app is enabled but your keys are not initialised, please log-out and log-in again
translations.Enabling this option encrypts all files: Enabling this option encrypts all files stored on the main storage, otherwise only files on external storage will be encrypted
translations.The recovery key is an additional encryp: The recovery key is an additional encryption key used to encrypt files. It is used to recover files from an account if the password is forgotten.
translations.Your private key password no longer matc: Your private key password no longer matches your log-in password.
translations.Set your old private key password to you: Set your old private key password to your current log-in password:
translations.If you do not remember your old password: If you do not remember your old password you can ask your administrator to recover your files.
translations.Enabling this option will allow you to r: Enabling this option will allow you to reobtain access to your encrypted files in case of password loss
translations.Default encryption module for server-sid: Default encryption module for server-side encryption
translations.In order to use this encryption module y:
In order to use this encryption module you need to enable server-side encryption in the admin settings. Once enabled this module will encrypt all your files transparently. The encryption is based on AES 256 keys.
The module will not touch existing files, only new files will be encrypted after server-side encryption was enabled. It is also not possible to disable the encryption again and switch back to an unencrypted system.
Please read the documentation to know all implications before you decide to enable server-side encryption.
